definition: open to the view of all/spacious/to open wide/to disclose

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: So dear friends , let's open our hearts and ears to enjoy music .
sentences.chinese: 親愛的朋友，讓我們敞開心靈和張開雙耳去感受音樂。

sentences.english: Ma'am Bougon was in the habit of leaving all the doors open.
sentences.chinese: 畢爾貢媽媽經常是讓那些房門敞開着的。

sentences.english: Pinyin is like a kind of 'Open sesame,' opening up the doors," he says.
sentences.chinese: 拼音就像“芝麻開門”，爲人們敞開了大門”他說。

sentences.english: The rich scent of rain and wet earth was blowing through the open window.
sentences.chinese: 雨水和溼土那厚重的味道透過敞開的窗子襲面而來。

sentences.english: Others may see doors open that lead them to financial success that were previously closed.
sentences.chinese: 而其他人會看到以前緊扣的經濟成功之門向他們敞開。

sentences.english: That’s right, you can be open-minded and think that others are wrong.
sentences.chinese: 也就是說，你可以是敞開心扉地認爲其他人是錯誤的。

sentences.english: Releasing the heart wall could actually change your life as you know it.
sentences.chinese: 敞開心扉會如你所願的真正改變你的人生。

sentences.english: You are the ones on earth who open the gate to the light.
sentences.chinese: 你們是在地球上向光明敞開大門的人。

sentences.english: While the front door is closed,there must be another open for you.
sentences.chinese: 當你的大門緊閉時，另一扇大門就一定會爲你敞開。

sentences.english: Hell and the court-room are always open.
sentences.chinese: 地獄和審判室的門永遠敞開着。

sentences.english: A long, recessed luminaire usually installed with the opening flush with the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 長形嵌入式燈具，安裝式通常爲敞開並與天花板齊平。

sentences.english: See grandma home door open, she was very much were amazed at.
sentences.chinese: 看到奶奶家的屋門敞開着，她感到很希奇。

sentences.english: Don't be surprised if doors start opening for you.
sentences.chinese: 別驚訝幸運之門爲你敞開。

sentences.english: Second, no one heals unless they decide to open up to healing.
sentences.chinese: 其次，沒有人會被療愈除非他決定向療愈敞開大門。

sentences.english: Are you willing to open up?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，你願意敞開你的心扉嗎？

sentences.english: I don't need the wishy-washy thing.
sentences.chinese: 你不能敞開心扉對我，那麼我也不要了。

definition: to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to bloom/to open/to be open (to the public)/to open up (to the outside)/to be open-minded/unrestrained by convention/unconstrained in one's sexuality
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
